intro: Loxonia acuminata, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
